content: Hello everyone,BitSwapNow is looking for some reviews from community members.The total number of reviews that will be paid: 20 Reviews/MaxAmount paid per review: 5$ 0.00025 BTC from now on.How to give a review-1. Visit Bitswapnow.com 2. Surf the website for what could be improved or what you want to be added.3. What do you think is good or bad on the website, your experience?4. Overall, just state your experience while visiting the website and leave your BTC address for payment.5. Only the top 20 reviews will be paid 0.00025 BTC  directly to their BTC address.6. Campaign will end in 24-48 hours. extended till all 20 reviews are given.Rules for Campaign:-No neg trusted accounts are allowed to enroll.-Do not enroll twice with Alts if found, then none of your reviews will be counted, and you may receive negative from other DT members or me.-Minimum 250-character long review.-If there are more than 20 Reviews posted by the community members, then only 20 reviews(max) will be paid, as stated above.-Campaign is open for Full Member and Plus (+)

comments.author: mocacinno
comments.created_time: November 07, 2022, 01:48:16 PMLast edit: November 07, 2022, 01:59:34 PM by mocacinno
comments.body: I just visited said website... First impressions: the GUI looks sleek and i see an R3 certificate... That's a big plus, no cloudflare MITM a lot of service fall for.Now, what did bother me (personally) is the fact that the homepage keeps on "scrolling". When i visit a site like this one, i just want to buy or swap coins, i don't want to see a section "Featured crypto News", let alone secions about "blockchain", "NFT's" or "altcoins". You're an exchange, if i want to read crypto news, i'll visit a site that's dedicated to posting news articles.A second (very minor) thing i saw => if you open your homepage, go to the "buy/sell crypto"- tab and then click "sell", the default values default to wanting to "sell" 3 ETH, which is over the maximum you're allowed to sell.. So just by clicking around without entering anything, i'm faced with a warning message... Not a big problem at all, just something you might want to look at?An other thing i see: you indicate "no extra fees", but the help-box makes it clear this means that the amount indicated is the amount i'll receive... You do add some fees (which is normal, you're a business afterall). Maybe it would be nice to indicate that you do charge a fee (maybe even tell us what the fee is?).I was checking your headers and suddenly noticed something... Is it correct you're running apache 2.4.6 (released in 2013)?When it comes to security headers... It might be a good idear to check the following (not all of them might apply to your case)Strict-Transport-Security Content-Security-Policy X-Frame-Options X-Content-Type-Options Referrer-PolicyPermissions-Policy

comments.author: Accardo
comments.body: I figured out that the color riot on the home page is not user friendly; having green,black and white arranged in that manner may not hold a user to further navigate the site. I think White should be the general background color then black for texts, just like the white section for swapping currency. Another thing is the news scattered around the homepage, they should be a menu for news on the navigation bar then the currencies section hidden under the exchange drop menu should be on the section where news are. Since its an exchange people should be able to see the rate of currencies first, reading blog can come handy after the trader is done trading.

comments.author: OmegaStarScream
comments.body: - The site is very similar to Changenow and I'm guessing you're using their API and you're one of their partners? You should probably change the site's design, this can be seen as a phishing attempt.- UX: You should ask for the payout address on the home page when the user is filling in the amount, instead of opening the same window again, and asking him for extra details.- I tried to exchange BTC for BTC. This shouldn't be possible to do, and yet, I was given an address to deposit funds.- The address validation is not working properly. The address can be invalid, and you would still get the green checkmark. if you proceed to the next step, you get this error:QuoteSomething went wrong. Try later or change your transaction. Error:Which is bad, because the user can't know that the problem is coming from the address and not something else, especially when you confirmed that the address is "good" in the previous step.

comments.author: rat03gopoh
comments.created_time: November 07, 2022, 02:10:47 PMLast edit: November 07, 2022, 02:35:51 PM by rat03gopoh
comments.body: When I sell crypto for fiat (ETH to EUR), it says that the maximum exchange rate is (eg) 1.2533274 on the alert, and when it is clicked then another alert will appear with a different maximum exchange rate. I clicked three times so in the end it failed to fetch the current amount (showing "- EUR"; see photo). I think you don't set a tolerance range for exchange rates even just a few cents, while you always take the latest price every new input.Edit: It would be nice if menu and sub menus captions can be renamed:⠀Exchange>> Swap BTC to BNB Swap BTC to ETH etc....⠀⠀⠀⠀into:⠀⠀⠀Swap >> BTC to BNB BTC to ETH etc....⠀⠀⠀More>> Cryptocurrencies>> Bitcoin (BTC) Crypto Exchange Binance Coin(BNB / BSC) Crypto Exchange etc....⠀⠀⠀⠀into:⠀⠀⠀More>> Exchanges >> Bitcoins (BTC) Binance Coin(BNB / BSC) etc....

comments.author: examplens
comments.body: OP, you need to make a final decision, what will be the main topic of your page?is it an exchanger or a blog site, price ticker...? first, this scrolling bar with the current prices of some tokens and coins is entirely useless and tiring. has anyone done an analysis, are there any people who use it and want to see it?Next, someone is already writing this, but again why do you have news on your front page if you are focused on coin exchange? you can have a blog section if you want to improve SEO for your site, but news that has already been published elsewhere will not contribute to a better ranking of your site. finally, since you are now using the Changenow widget, if you gain confidence over time, do you plan to switch to your own service? it could be complicated because you will gain your trust using someone else service, not yours. the possibility of abuse opens up here.Quote from: OmegaStarScream on November 07, 2022, 02:09:43 PM- The site is very similar to Changenow and I'm guessing you're using their API and you're one of their partners? You should probably change the site's design, this can be seen as a phishing attempt.He uses the Changenow widget added through iFrame on the WordPress site. Nothing is illegal because they Changenow consciously allowed it. anyone can put it on their site or page. Check here https://changenow.io/embeds/widgetbut that can open another problem over time.

comments.author: OmegaStarScream
comments.body: Quote from: examplens on November 07, 2022, 03:09:04 PMHe uses the Changenow widget added through iFrame on the WordPress site. Nothing is illegal because they Changenow consciously allowed it. anyone can put it on their site or page. Check here https://changenow.io/embeds/widgetbut that can open another problem over time.I realize that it's not illegal but when both the widget and home page look similar, some people might see it that way. I think it'd be wiser to change the frontend a bit.

comments.author: Woodie
comments.body: FIRST VISIT IMPRESSIONUpon visiting BitSwapNow.com, I got the impression this has a changelly.com, changenow.io touch to it which I don't mind but I felt its too dull to see some other parts of the website which might be deliberate as the attention might be directed at the exchange box itself..which is understandable.THE GOOD, THE BAD, THE UGLYThe Good part about BitSwapNow.com is its simplicity of use , and the Trust pilot button goes to show its centered around providing good customer service will easily get people to use the service.The Bad/Ugly- I believe not everyone is familiar with non custodial exchange services and some kind of tutorial will be helpful to newcomers to the platform. One last thing, the contract of the exchange box needs to be increased to help users know what exactly they are doing.CONCLUSIONOverall its a clean site but I feel the news articles arent necessary as they could misdirect a potential customer away from the platform that was looking for answers from the FAQ section, all in all, good site 8/10 rating for me.BtC addy: bc1q6pm0afcphvqp594fgna8u63gza37qkrm3wvf0s

I will for sure cover everyone's concerns and issues as well as tweaking the homepage about the news ect. Just finishing up a holiday for a few days and will review and resume later this week. Still looking for some more reviews and ideas/concerns.

comments.author: rby
comments.body: OverviewNice UI/UX, the color combinations are so unique. The mode is cool, just like my favourite dark mode. Is there any provisions for change of mode, incase of people that don't like it dark. The Hero BannerThe Hero banner where coins are exchanged renders even when not prompted and generate some amount of coins. I don't know the reason behind it, it would be nice to see a placeholder "0" in the input to save the user the stress of clearing the input before using. Multi languageI may sound funny, but any site that has multiple languages gives me the impression that the company is big and multi national. This is a plus to the site.FAQsI was looking for FAQs until I saw this QuoteFurthermore we have compiled a list of frequently asked questions for you to browse. If you cannot still find the answer your looking for then please feel free to contact us.I knew there was FAQs.I'll suggest you move it to the top or bottom of the footer and name it FAQS instead of writing it in full. FAQs is faster and more convenient to find.
